--our player is usually a nice thing to have local Player = game:GetService("Players").LocalPlayer --the mouse is handy local Mouse = Player:GetMouse() --we'll want an easy reference to the tool local Tool = script.Parent --this is our way of communicating with the server side of things local Remote = Tool:WaitForChild("Remote") --first, acquire our input source local CAS = game:GetService("ContextActionService") --we'll use this variable later to uniquely identify our context actions local ActionName = "LightReflectionSword"
--this function is filtered to by context action service function onAttack(actionName, inputState, inputObject) if inputState == Enum.UserInputState.Begin then Remote:FireServer("AttackStarted", Mouse.Hit.p) end
if inputState == Enum.UserInputState.End then Remote:FireServer("AttackEnded", Mouse.Hit.p) end end
--when the sword is equipped, bind our actions function onEquipped() --make sure we unequipped onUnequipped()
--bind CAS:BindActionToInputTypes( ActionName, onAttack, false, Enum.UserInputType.MouseButton1, Enum.UserInputType.Touch ) end Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped)
--when we unequip, unbind the action function onUnequipped() CAS:UnbindAction(ActionName) end Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)

--get a quick reference to the tool and handle local Tool = script.Parent local Handle = Tool:WaitForChild("Handle") --a short reference to math.random local R = math.random --this remote receives input events from the client local Remote = Tool:WaitForChild("Remote") --these parts will serve as the basis for some effects local Cube = Instance.new("Part") Cube.FormFactor = "Custom" Cube.Size = Vector3.new(1, 1, 1) Cube.Anchored = true Cube.CanCollide = false Cube.TopSurface = "Smooth" Cube.BottomSurface = "Smooth" Cube.Material = "SmoothPlastic" local Cylinder = Cube:Clone() Instance.new("CylinderMesh", Cylinder) local Sphere = Cube:Clone() Instance.new("SpecialMesh", Sphere).MeshType = "Sphere" --this is a quick reference to heartbeat local Heartbeat = Game:GetService("RunService").Heartbeat --this variable holds our heartbeat connection local Connection --this variable holds the motor so we can destroy it on an unequip local Motor --the following variables affect the behavior of the weapon local CanSwing = true local SwingReload = 1.5 local SwingTimer = 0 local CanDamage = false local DamageAmount = 20 local SwingType = "Normal1"
local NumberCharges = 0 local MaxCharges = 5 local ChargeTimer = 0 local ChargeParts = {}
local SpecialAttackDamage = 45 local SpecialAttackEffectTimer = 0 local SpecialAttackEffectLastPosition local SpecialAttackEffectDamage = 7.5
--this function decrements the swing timer if we're unable to swing function handleSwingTimer(dt) if not CanSwing then SwingTimer = SwingTimer - dt if SwingTimer <= 0 then CanSwing = true end end end
--this function handles the graphical repercussions of the coolness of the special attack function handleSpecialAttackGraphics(dt) if SpecialAttackEffectTimer > 0 then SpecialAttackEffectTimer = SpecialAttackEffectTimer - dt
local a = Handle.CFrame:pointToWorldSpace(Vector3.new(0, 1.5, 0)) if SpecialAttackEffectLastPosition then sunbeam(a, SpecialAttackEffectLastPosition, 1/2) end SpecialAttackEffectLastPosition = a else SpecialAttackEffectLastPosition = nil end end
--this function handles the graphical consequences of having charges function handleCharges(dt) ChargeTimer = ChargeTimer + dt if NumberCharges > 0 then local theta = ChargeTimer * 4 local thetaStep = (math.pi * 2) / NumberCharges local radius = 2 for index = 1, NumberCharges do local charge = ChargeParts[index] local dx = math.cos(theta) * radius local dy = math.sin(theta) * radius charge.CFrame = Handle.CFrame:toWorldSpace(CFrame.new(dx, 1.25, dy)) theta = theta + thetaStep end end end
--this function tags the target for integration of the default leaderboard function tagHuman(human) local val = Instance.new("ObjectValue") val.Name = "creator" val.Value = getPlayer() val.Parent = human game:GetService("Debris"):AddItem(val, 1) end
--this helper function returns if a table contains a value function contains(t, v) for _, val in pairs(t) do if val == v then return true end end return false end
--this function makes a sunbeam between two points function sunbeam(a, b, t) local middle = (a + b) / 2 local length = (b - a).magnitude
local beam = Cylinder:Clone() beam.Size = Vector3.new(0.2, length, 0.2) beam.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright yellow") beam.Transparency = 0.5 beam.Material = "Marble" beam.CFrame = CFrame.new(middle, b) * CFrame.Angles(math.pi / 2, 0, 0) beam.Parent = workspace game:GetService("Debris"):AddItem(beam, t) end
--this function makes a crater function crater(pos, t) local twoPi = math.pi * 2 local thetaStep = twoPi / 12
for theta = thetaStep, twoPi, thetaStep do local length = math.random() * 2.5 local dx = math.cos(theta) * (length / 2) local dz = math.sin(theta) * (length / 2) local d = pos + Vector3.new(dx, 0, dz)
local burn = Cube:Clone() burn.Size = Vector3.new(0.4, 0.2, length) burn.CFrame = CFrame.new(d, pos) burn.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Really black") burn.Parent = workspace game:GetService("Debris"):AddItem(burn, t) end end
--this function deals the special attack damage using explosions function specialAttackDamage(position) local affectedHumans = {}
local e = Instance.new("Explosion") e.BlastRadius = 6 e.BlastPressure = 0 e.Position = position e.Hit:connect(function(part, distance) if part.Parent and part.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") then local human = part.Parent.Humanoid if not contains(affectedHumans, human) then tagHuman(human) human:TakeDamage(SpecialAttackDamage) table.insert(affectedHumans, human) end end end) e.Parent = workspace end
--this is the main part of the weapon, a central tick function onTick(dt) --first, handle the swing timer handleSwingTimer(dt)
--next, the charge timer handleCharges(dt)
--special attack graphics handleSpecialAttackGraphics(dt) end
--this function returns the player of this weapon function getPlayer() local char = Tool.Parent if char then return game:GetService("Players"):GetPlayerFromCharacter(char) end end
--this function converts a weld to a motor for animation function convertWeldToMotor(weld) local m = Instance.new("Motor6D") m.Name = weld.Name m.Part0 = weld.Part0 m.Part1 = weld.Part1 m.C0 = weld.C0 m.C1 = weld.C1
local parent = weld.Parent weld:Destroy() m.Parent = parent
Motor = m end
--when we equip, we start up the clock function onEquipped() --make SURE that we unequipped onUnequipped()
--connect the heartbeat Connection = Heartbeat:connect(onTick)
--put the charges into the tool toggleCharges(true)
--as soon as we can, replace "right grip" with a motor while not Tool.Parent do wait() end while not Tool.Parent:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") do wait() end convertWeldToMotor(Tool.Parent["Right Arm"]:WaitForChild("RightGrip")) end
--when we unequip, stop the clock function onUnequipped() if Connection then Connection:disconnect() end
--prevent the motor from causing problems if Motor then Motor:Destroy() end
--put the charges back into nil toggleCharges(false) end
--this function plays a sound with a random pitch function playSound(name) local sound = Handle:FindFirstChild(name) if sound then sound.Pitch = math.random(90, 110)/100 sound:Play() end end
--when the blade is touched, if we can damage, we deal damage and add a charge function onTouched(part) --if we can't damage, don't bother if not CanDamage then return end
--if the part's parent exists and has a humanoid, damage it if part.Parent and part.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") then --damage the person local human = part.Parent.Humanoid tagHuman(human) human:TakeDamage(DamageAmount) --charge up addCharge() --turn off the damage CanDamage = false --play a sound playSound("HitSound")
--special buff!? if SpecialAttackEffectTimer > 0 then human:TakeDamage(SpecialAttackEffectDamage) playSound("SpecialHitSound")
if human.Parent:FindFirstChild("Torso") then local fire = Instance.new("Fire") fire.Color = BrickColor.new("New Yeller").Color fire.SecondaryColor = BrickColor.new("Bright yellow").Color fire.Parent = human.Parent.Torso delay(1, function() fire.Enabled = false end) game:GetService("Debris"):AddItem(fire, 2) end end end end
--this function adds a charge to the blade, handling some math and rendering for us function addCharge() --add a charge, but ensure we don't pass the max NumberCharges = NumberCharges + 1 if NumberCharges > MaxCharges then NumberCharges = MaxCharges end --show off the charges! toggleCharges(true) end
--this function easily toggles charges on or off, as well as refreshing the number of them function toggleCharges(on) if on then toggleCharges(false)
for index = 1, NumberCharges do local charge = ChargeParts[index] charge.Parent = Tool end else for index = 1, MaxCharges do local charge = ChargeParts[index] charge.Parent = nil end ChargeTimer = 0 end end
--this function performs a special attack with the axe function specialAttack() --can't swing? can't special if not CanSwing then return end
--animate! Remote:FireClient(getPlayer(), "PlayAnimation", "Special") wait(0.1)
--make sure we have a root part if Tool.Parent and Tool.Parent:FindFirstChild("HumanoidRootPart") then --explosions! local root = Tool.Parent.HumanoidRootPart local feet = root.Position - Vector3.new(0, 2.5, 0) local radius = 14 local rads = math.pi * 2 local thetaStep = rads / 5 for theta = thetaStep, rads, thetaStep do local dx = math.cos(theta) * radius local dz = math.sin(theta) * radius local pos = feet + Vector3.new(dx, 0, dz) specialAttackDamage(pos)
local a = Handle.CFrame:pointToWorldSpace(Vector3.new(0, 2, 0)) local b = pos sunbeam(a, b, 1/10) crater(b, 8) end
--sounds! playSound("SunFireExplosion")
--charge control NumberCharges = 0 toggleCharges(true)
--special attack effect timer SpecialAttackEffectTimer = 6 end end
--this function performs a normal strike with the blade function normalAttack() --if we can't swing, don't bother if not CanSwing then return end
--tell our touched handler we can deal damage CanDamage = true --after a short delay, we can't damage anymore. delay(1, function() CanDamage = false end)
--we can't swing for another bit CanSwing = false SwingTimer = SwingReload
--swing the sword and play a sound! Remote:FireClient(getPlayer(), "PlayAnimation", SwingType) if SwingType == "Normal1" then delay(0.15, function() playSound("SwingSound") end) SwingType = "Normal2" else SwingType = "Normal1" playSound("SwingSound") end end
--this function is called once, right away, in order to prep the sword for use --all events are connected here in order to ensure everything is ready function setUp() --create and store the charges we may need for index = 1, MaxCharges do local charge = Sphere:Clone() charge.Mesh.Scale = Vector3.new(3/4, 3/4, 3/4) charge.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright yellow") charge.Transparency = 0.5 charge.Material = "Marble" ChargeParts[index] = charge end
--connect events Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped) Handle.Touched:connect(onTouched)
--this remote event connection is more complex Remote.OnServerEvent:connect(function(player, func, ...) --if it isn't our player, don't bother if player.Character ~= Tool.Parent then return end
--store the arguments in a table local args = {...}
--start the logic if func == "AttackStarted" then --if we don't have all the charges, do a normal attack --otherwise, we start the pew pew process if NumberCharges < MaxCharges then normalAttack() else specialAttack() end end end) end
setUp()
